body:
So today I was playing Nexus, a very rare occurence, and I came across a map with four teams, idk what it was called, I don't play it ever. 

But anyways, it was four teams, two of the. Had two players, but my team and another only had 1. Sine we were down a player, and both pretty sure this one guy was hacking, we kind of made a mutual agreement not to kill each other. It wasn't really a team, more of like an ignorance if their existence like "I will allow u to live, fellow underdog".

just wanted to know if u could get punished for this. I'm pretty sure u can, but it seemed ok at the time.

~higger

title: Nexus Teams

replies.body: I think teaming with players on other teams is punishable, not sure.
replies.body_tagged: I think teaming with players on other teams is punishable, not sure.

replies.body: Teaming with other teams is punishable, yes.
replies.body_tagged: Teaming with other teams is punishable, yes.

replies.body:
Yes it is punishable, thanks for being honest and making sure
It is punishable or not make sure you don't do it again! :P

replies.body:
I think this should be allowed in that type of situation.

Sometimes I 'truce' with another team with low players before the walls drop because imho its quite unfair that most of our team got teamkilled and the teamkiller left. So if it's like a 2v2v5v6 then I might truce with the other team.
